item.title: Around The World For Free – Season 3
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Keeping with our recent trend of breaking outdated news, we're announcing that we finished the coding on the new interactive map for the third season of Around The World For Free.

The post Around The World For Free – Season 3 appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Keeping with our recent trend of breaking outdated news, we’re announcing that we finished the coding on the new interactive map for the third season of Around The World For Free.

The season is coming to an end actually but you can still go click around the interactive map and see what Parvati has been up to.

As always we give thanks to Anthony and Brian for all their hard work on the project and many thanks as well to Bright Red for bringing us this project and managing it. And last but certainly not least, the custom CMS that powers the map was done by Grail Interactive!

The post Around The World For Free – Season 3 appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Focus on the Amazing Race
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Thanks to our friends at BrightRed Pixels, we just finished programming another job for CBS, this time for Amazing Race. Click around and have fun...

The post Focus on the Amazing Race appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished programming another job for CBS in conjunction with BrightRed Pixels, this time for Amazing Race.

We were able to deliver a very cool interactive app on a tight deadline thanks to our rockstar programmers Anthony Tripaldi and Brian Maci.

The post Focus on the Amazing Race appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Launch: Around The World For Free
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Here's a big one... We just finished collaborating with BrightRedPixels on the interactive map for CBS's second season of Around The World For Free!

The post Launch: Around The World For Free appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Here’s a big one… We just finished collaborating with BrightRedPixels on the interactive map for CBS’s second season of Around The World For Free! The Champion makes its way around the world without any money, just some help from the people using our app.

We display Jeff’s location on a Google Map and we plot his journey by connecting the bits of media he uploads from his GPS enabled devices. Users can see where he’s been and where he’s trying to get to and drop tips or photos along the way to help him out.

We’d like to thank Anthony Tripaldi and Brian Maci, the flash developers on our team for kicking major butt on this project. For more insight into the technical side of things, read Anthony’s blog post. They worked closely with Grant at Grail Interactive who created the custom CMS that sends us the info we need to display. Unfortunately I don’t know the name of the bitcoin trading platforms that created the look and feel, but maybe someone reading this can comment below for the record.

Some of the ATWFF’s features

  • Sending SMS texts to Jeff’s phone
  • We ping a weather service to show the weather icons behind jeff’s image
  • We interfaced with CBS’s login and video modules so they could deliver content to the app that also lives on their site
  • Facebook integration
  • We use SWFAddress to deep link all the content on the site
  • Lots of user interaction tracking
  • much much more, stop reading and check it out already!

The post Launch: Around The World For Free appeared first on mimoYmima.
